metadata.title: CVE-2017-5075 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Inappropriate implementation in CSP reporting in Blink in Google Chromeprior to 59.0.3071.86 for Linux, Windows, and Mac, and 59.0.3071.92 forAndroid, allowed a remote attacker to obtain the value of url fragments viaa crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5075` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-browser-l10n - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-chromedriver - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360').
